lines.content: * The Command Class encapsulates the functions to check the input string with the available commands.
* The Enum Class encapsulates all the available commands.
* This method Run the Scanner to begin taking inputs from user, and check to see which commands to run.
* Deadline class is a task that contains a name and an end date
* This method gives the string representation of a deadline task when it is in a list
* @return The String representation of a Deadline Task
* The DeadlineException Class is used when user does not follow the deadline input format.
* This method gives the string representation of DeadlineException
* @return The String representation of an DeadlineException
return "☹ This is not a valid Deadline input";
* Duke is entry point of our program
* The DukeException Class is used when user does not follow any input format.
* This method gives the string representation of DukeException
* @return The String representation of an DukeException
return "☹ This is not a valid input";
* Event class is a task that contains a name and an end date and a start date
public Event (String name, String from, String to) {
* This method gives the string representation of a event task when it is in a list
* @return The String representation of an event Task
* The EventException Class is used when user does not follow Event input format.
* This method gives the string representation of EventException
* @return The String representation of an EventException
return "☹ This is not a valid event input";
* This class encapsulates the functions used to print statements when user enters and exits the program.
* This method prints out the line when user start the program
String greeting = "Hello! I'm chatbot\nWhat can I do for you?";
* This method prints out the line when user exit the program
String bye = "Bye. Hope to see you again soon!";

* This method add a Todo task to the item list.

System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");

* This method add an Event task to the item list.
* @param newitem the string name of the event task.

* This method print out the items currently in the list

* This method mark the event at a specified index as done
* @param index the index of the task to be marked done
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
* This method mark the event at a specified index as undone
* @param index the index of the task to be marked undone
System.out.println("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
* This method delete the event at a specified index.
* @param index the index of the task to be deleted.
* The Task class contains a name and its status (if it is done or not done), and the functions to set it as
* done/undone, and give the string representations of it, its status and it in a list
* This method set this task as done
* This method set this task as undone

* @return the string representation of the done status of a task.

* ToDo class is a task that contains a name only without any dates
* This method gives the string representation of a ToDo task when it is in a list
* @return The String representation of a todo Task
* The ToDoException Class is used when user does not follow Event input format.
